title: Concave lens - principal ray through focal point

content.question: An object is located to the left of a concave lens, as shown in the figure. The dots in the figure are located at the focal points and are each a distance <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> from the lens. Which of the following is a correct ray diagram for a principal ray that originates from the tip of the object?

choices.label: The figure shows a concave lens on its optical axis represented by dash line. The two focal points are shown, one on each side of the lens. Past the focal point on the left, an arrow is shown pointing up from the optical axis. From the tip of the arrow a ray travels down and to the right passing through the left focal point, then strikes the lens above the bottom edge of the lens. From this point the ray travels towards the right parallel to the optical axis.

The figure shows a concave lens on its optical axis represented by dash line. The two focal points are shown, one on each side of the lens. Past the focal point on the left, an arrow is shown pointing up from the optical axis. From the tip of the arrow a ray travels down and to the right passing through the left focal point, then strikes the lens above the bottom edge of the lens. From this point the outgoing ray travels upwards and to the right crossing the focal point to the right of the lens.

The figure shows a concave lens on its optical axis represented by dash line. The two focal points are shown, one on each side of the lens. Past the focal point on the left, an arrow is shown pointing up from the optical axis. From the tip of the arrow a ray travels down and to the right striking the lens above the optical axis. The outgoing ray then travels to the right parallel to the optical axis. From the point where the ray enters the lens, a dash line extends the path of the ray without deflection and ends at the focal point to the right of the lens.

The figure shows a concave lens on its optical axis represented by dash line. The two focal points are shown, one on each side of the lens. Past the focal point on the left, an arrow is shown pointing up from the optical axis. From the tip of the arrow a ray travels down and to the right striking the lens above the optical axis. The outgoing ray then travels upwards and to the right. From the point where the ray enters the lens, a dash line extends the path of the ray incident on the lens without deflection and ends at the focal point to the right of the lens. Also, another dash line extends back from the outgoing ray and ends at the focal point to the left of the lens.

content.answer: The figure shows a concave lens on its optical axis represented by dash line. The two focal points are shown, one on each side of the lens. Past the focal point on the left, an arrow is shown pointing up from the optical axis. From the tip of the arrow a ray travels down and to the right striking the lens above the optical axis. The outgoing ray then travels to the right parallel to the optical axis. From the point where the ray enters the lens, a dash line extends the path of the ray without deflection and ends at the focal point to the right of the lens.
